--- Page 1 ---
    Screen/Holland 
    Blinds 
1.
Measurement of Screen/Holland blind.  All our roller blinds will be manufactured in width as pin 
measure (outside of bracket to outside of bracket) as illustrated below. Measurement is in millimeters 
(mm) and always width first then drop.  
If you have a recess fit, we suggest that you order the blind at the tight fit measurement. This will fit 
perfectly from all the feedback we have had from you.  
2. 
Roll direction.  The standard or default for roller blinds is standard or normal roll, otherwise known 
as under roll or back roll.  This means the fabric is coming off the back of the roller closest to the 
window glass. Specify Overoll if you require the blind to front roll or have the fabric coming off the front 
of the blind away from the window. 
2.
Screen/Holland Blind Control.  All Screen/Holland blinds come standard with chain control and 
metal chain.  The control mechanism we use is the Sunboss system. It is by far the world leader in 
chain drive roller blind systems.  This is an evolving range and continues to grow and expand their 
component range. Chain lengths are specified in a chart at the end of this section. Plastic chains are 
also available at no extra cost. Plastic chain and control colors are White, Cream, Beige, Grey and 
Black.  Stainless steel chains can be supplied at an extra charge of $14.40. Please specify if required. A 
Direct drive chain control is fitted to blinds up to 2499 in width. Blinds 2500 and over in width are fitted 
with Gear Drive controls.  You have the option to select Direct Drive Control with a Helper Spring/Spring 
Assist for an extra $28.35. You must specify on your order if you wish to have this option. 
Chain Control Colours  


--- Page 2 ---
4. 
Screen/Holland Sizes.  Minimum Blind width for a Chain Blind is 250mm. The maximum blind width we 
recommend is 3200mm. The maximum drop for a screen/holland blind we recommended is 3000mm.  
Any sizes larger than the recommended will not be covered by Warranty.  Please note that small blinds 
occasionally track and do not roll up straight. Curling of fabric is more likely on smaller blinds also. 
5. 
Light Filter Fabrics. Some light filter fabrics fray regardless of the way in which they are cut. We do 
not guarantee light filter fabric against fraying. You may request to have side hems on these which 
would attract an extra charge as set out below.
6. 
Fabric Bagging or ‘V’ing.  Larger blinds, both Hollands and 
screens could show fabric bagging or wavering. The width of 
the blind as well as the weight of the fabric contribute to this 
effect.  Screen/Holland blinds wider than 2500mm and/or 
longer than 3000mm are more likely to bag.  To reduce this 
effect, consider splitting the blind into several blinds or use 
63mm tube. Soft backed fabric is more likely to bag.
7. 
Fabric Railroading and Joining.  If the blind ordered is wider 
than the fabric roll width, it will be railroaded (fabric turned 
sideways).  This often causes curling or cupping on the sides of 
the blind and is not covered by warranty.  We do not guarantee 
that this will go away entirely over time so please make your 
customer aware. If the drop of the blind ordered is also longer 
than the railroaded fabric width, it will be horizontally joined.  The 
join is sewn and therefore light pinholes may appear across this 
join. 
8. 
Side Hems. We do not recommend or guarantee side hems on all polyester fabrics as they do not hang 
straight.  We only apply side hems to Bonded Blinds (no cost) and light filter fabrics on request (extra 
$18.00).
9. 
Zero Gravity. Zero Gravity control spring when installed gives the roller blind that weightless feeling 
when it is raised and lowered.  Zero Gravity can be added as an option to your roller blind as either 
chainless operation and also used in conjunction with a motor ($65.60) or with a chain control to allow 
operation through the lightest touch or movement ($46.00). 
.
10. 
Helper Springs/Gear Drives. Our pricing includes a Gear drive unit for blinds 2500mm wide and over 
as standard. You have the option of selecting a Helper Spring with a Direct drive instead. You must 
specify if you wish to have the helper spring instead on your order. Upgrade from a Gear Drive to Direct 
Drive with Helper Spring is $28.35.
11. 
Tube Sizes. We automatically supply 38mm tubes for blinds under 2100mm in width. Blinds 2100mm in 
width or greater will be on 50mm tubes.  We recommend 63mm tube for blinds over 2800mm, we leave 
that choice to you.  There is an extra cost for tube and the larger control and pin end.  When motorizing 
a Screen or Holland blind, a 50mm Tube is used. If the blind is under 2100mm wide, please add $6/mt 
for the upgrade of the tube and $3.80 for the extra adaptors. 
12. 
Linked blinds. We recommend and guarantee two (2) linked blinds. Linked blinds will be treated as a 
single blind as far as tube sizing is concerned. If the combined width is less than 2100mm then a 38mm 
tube is used. When the combined width is 2100 or greater then 50mm tube is used and this will incur an 
extra charge along with the larger control and pin end.  For sizes greater than 2500, a helper spring or 
Gear drive will need to be added and charged accordingly. 


--- Page 3 ---
13. 
Extra costs for common accessories and components. 
** 
Compact Double Bracket kit - $15.50 available in (white, black, grey, cream and beige) 
** 
Vertical BR-BR Double Bracket Kit  - $17.10 available in (white, black, grey, cream and beige) 
** 
Multi-Link or Inline Link (no bracket) – $35.50 
** 
Heavy Duty 63mm Tube – extra $11 per metre 
** 
Wrapped Bottom Rail – extra $15.75 per meter 
** 
Rubber Insert for bottom rail– extra $1.70 per meter 
** 
Helper Springs/Spring Assists with adapter - $33.25 each 
** 
Single bracket covers 40mm - $1.50 per pair 
** 
Double bracket covers - $6.05 per pair 
** 
Universal link 0-75o set - $148 No bracket (Universal joint coupling and adapters for each blind) 
** 
Tassles - $7.80 
** 
Gold and Silver Rings - $4.60 each 
** 
Crochet pull Rings - $4.60 each 
14. 
Printing on Blinds. Please call the office for up-to-date pricing and fabric suitability. 
15. 
Bottom Rail. Bottom rail comes in two profiles, Ellipse and Flat. We use the Hunter Douglas Ellipse 
bottom rail which is superior in quality, weight and has the option of a rubber rear insert.  It comes in 
eight colours – Anodised, Black, White, Magnolia, Limestone, Granite, Bronze and Gunmetal. The Flat 
Bottom rail is from Blindware and comes in White, Black and Anodised. Both these bottom rails also 
have the option of a rubber strip insert at the back to reduce the noise when the blind hits the window. 
Further to that we have introduced a wrapped bottom rail where we use the Romatech no sew bottom 
rail to wrap the fabric around the rail. Wrapped bottom rail colours are White, Black and Anodised. 
This attracts an extra cost of $15.75 per meter. 
**Please specify bottom rail colour on your order. We do not match bottom rail on your behalf. 
Ellipse Bottom Rail Colours
16. 
Sunboss Fascia (Aluminium). Sunboss Aluminium Fascia is available to complement your blinds at a 
cost of $29.40p/mt for 75mm Square, $38p/mt for the 100mm Square, and $47.70p/mt for the Double 
Curved.Fabric Wrapping for the 100m and Double curved Fascia is an extra $18.90p/mt. Colours are 
Anodised, White, Birch and Black.  Remember you can retrofit the Sunboss fascia over existing rollers, 
verticals and panel glides. 


--- Page 4 ---
17. 
Linea Valance.  Linea Valance is available in two sizes, 98mm or 140mm. Colours available are White, 
Cotta and Black. The maximum single piece is 3600mm for all colours. Valance’s greater than 3600mm 
will come in two pieces with valance joiners.  If the valance is wider than the fabric to be inserted, the 
fabric will be joined on either side evenly with a full width as a centre panel. Please specify if you would 
like the fabric railroaded to avoid this.  Railroading the fabric will incur a 25% surcharge.  Price 98mm 
Linea Valance with any fabric insert at $36p/mt and 140mm Linea Valance with any fabric insert at 
$51p/mt.  If the fabric is bonded or railroaded then inserted, the cost is an extra $15p/mt. 
18. 
Designer Pricing.  Hollands that fall within the Designer range are priced at Fancy plus 10%. 
19. 
Elegant Pricing.  Hollands that fall within the Elegant range are priced at Fancy plus 20%. 
20. 
Braid.  Please note, we only supply Sullivans 12mm Rayon Braid (ART:1462). You can supply any 
other type of Braid with your order.  Fringing from Sullivans is also available in 75mm only. 
21. 
Safety.  Each blind is supplied with a chain safe device which is designed to fix and tension the chain in 
compliance with child safe regulations. 
22. 
Corner blind deductions.  If fitting blinds in a corner with one blind going through all the way and a 
butting blind on the other side, deduct 75mm for a blind using 40mm bracket, 85mm for a blind using 
55mm bracket and 105mm for a blind using 75mm bracket. Both through and butt blinds will be on the 
same size tube. 
23. 
Standard Chain Sizes (Screens and Hollands).  Chains are available in Plastic, Nickel and Stainless 
Steel. Maximum looped chain size is 3000mm. Any size above 3000mm and up to 6000mm can be 
made in Nickel or Stainless steel and will incur an extra charge of $6.00.  You can request different 
chain sizes on your order form if required. 
Chain Size
Blind Size (Drop)
500mm
200mm - 800mm
750mm
801mm – 1200mm
1000mm
1201mm – 1500mm
1250mm
1501mm – 1700mm
1500mm
1701mm – 2200mm
1750mm
2201mm – 2700mm
2000mm
2701mm – 3000mm
2500mm
3001mm – 3500mm
3000mm
3501mm – 5000mm


--- Page 5 ---
    Holland Blind  
    Finishes 
All Blind finishes are available in chain, Zero Gravity or Motor control. Please 
specify control type.  You also have the option to add Tassle, Pull ring or Bolt on 
Ring to any of the finishes below.   
PLAIN FINISH 
 
FANCY FINISH 
Plain(sewn pocket with Lathe) 
 
Bottom sewn pocket with ellipse Bottom rail insert 
MORE FANCY FINISHES 
  Round Cut Out        Square Cut Out 
  Siam Cut Out         Multiple Round       Multiple Square         Multiple Siam 
Bottom Lathe              Bottom Rail 
   Wrapped Bottom rail  
Bottom Rail with Rubber Insert 
DESIGNER FINISHES 
    Round Scallops          Inverted Scallops             Single Georgian       Continuous Georgian   Inverted deep scallop 
        Tis Tassel                  Triple lathe 
ELEGANT FINISHES 
Bonded fabric insert           Rouche insert            
All the above finishes are programmed in the 
cutting tables and priced accordingly. Pricing 
will need to be worked out for any other 
custom finish. 
Fabric wrapped 
bottom rail charged 
at an extra $15.75 
per meter on top of 
Fancy Price. 
There is an extra charge for all blinds 
with a Tassle or Ring.  Please add $7.80 
for Tassle and $4.60 for Pull and Bolt 
on Ring
$1.70 per 
meter on top 
of Fancy 
Price.
Another 
Fancy finish 
is T23 with 
Steel Insert

INCLUDED IN THE PRICE 
Tubes Sizes: 38mm Tube for all Blinds up to 2099 in width and 50mm for blinds 2100 or greater in width.
Blinds that are 2500 or greater in width will automatically have gear drive or helper spring.
GROUP 2 - PLAIN

INCLUDED IN THE PRICE 
Tubes Sizes: 38mm Tube for all Blinds up to 2099 in width and 50mm for blinds 2100 or greater in width.
Blinds that are 2500 or greater in width will automatically have gear drive or helper spring.

INCLUDED IN THE PRICE 
Tubes Sizes: 38mm Tube for all Blinds up to 2099 in width and 50mm for blinds 2100 or greater in width.
Blinds that are 2500 or greater in width will automatically have gear drive or helper spring.

INCLUDED IN THE PRICE 
Tubes Sizes: 38mm Tube for all Blinds up to 2099 in width and 50mm for blinds 2100 or greater in width.
Blinds that are 2500 or greater in width will automatically have gear drive or helper spring.

INCLUDED IN THE PRICE 
Tubes Sizes: 38mm Tube for all Blinds up to 2099 in width and 50mm for blinds 2100 or greater in width.
Blinds that are 2500 or greater in width will automatically have gear drive or helper spring.

--- Page 14 ---
Additional Roller components and prices
Effective Mar 2025
Things to check for:
ITEM
Picture
Cost
Unit
38mm Pin End
$1.45
Each
Sunboss Direct Drive (38mm) 
Excludes Chain
$7.10
Each
Sunboss Gear Drive
$12.00
Each
38/50mm Tube Adapter
$2.10
Each
38/63mm Tube Adapter
$2.75
Each
40mm Bracket
$1.30
Each
55mm Bracket
$1.63
Each
75mm Bracket
$2.40
Each
Compact Double Bracket Kit
$15.50
Set
We suggest you use the same size tube for blinds that are side by side with sizes above and below 2099 mm
We suggest you use the same size tube for blinds that are butting with sizes above and below 2099 mm
Term for connected blinds that operate together is Linked blinds using a (Multi Link) or (Inline Link) with insert
Blinds with common centre bracket but operate separately is Intermediate using Interdediate bracket and insert
Bay or corner window linked blinds up to a 75 degree angle can use a Universal joint coupling as a link
When multi-link blinds are ordered there is an extra charge for the multi-link system
Extra charge when a specified finish is different to our listed finishes
 - A Fancy finish with an extra is priced as Designer
 - A Designer finish with an extra is priced as Elegant
 - An Elegant finish with an extra is priced as Elegant plus 15%
Blinds that are linked will need to go to 50mm Tube if the combined length exceeds 2099
